medical_history.chief_complaint: Very preterm preeclampsia with elevated circulating sFlt-1 levels.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 27-32 weeks gestation as elevated blood pressure and proteinuria. Blood pressures recorded were as high as 223/116 mm Hg. Symptoms were progressive, requiring hospitalization and intervention.
